subSections.title: C.1 HMIS Indicator Review

inputRows.label: % pregnant women who provided LLIN at ANC

subSections.instruction: Instructions:Download and print out the previous quarter's HMIS data from the ZAMEP MSDQI EDS.Attach document or write in numbers below.Note: This is information will not be entered into the ZAMEP MSDQI EDS.

subSections.title: D.1 Staff training

inputRows.label: Total number of ANC staff employed at this facility
How many RCH staff received ANC/malaria case management training?(both formal and on job trainings)
Proportion of ANC staffs trained on malaria case management
How many ANC staff received mRDT training?(both formal and on job trainings)
Proportion of ANC staffs trained on mRDT

subSections.instruction: Instructions:Supervisor,enquire about staff who have received ANC training parkage

Zanzibar Guidelines for Malaria Diagnosis and Treatment

subSections.title: E.2 Clinical History and Physical Exam

inputRows.label: Use of LLIN (Long Lasting Insecticide-treated bed net)
If the patient has been previously screened for malaria during the current pregnancy using mRDT
Did the provider take the following vital signs:
Temperature if woman complains of fever(N/A if no fever)
Clinical History & Physical Exam observation sub score
SUB-SCORE: E.2 Clinical History & Physical Exam<

subSections.title: E.3 Assessment of Danger Signs/Symptoms

inputRows.label: Assessment Danger Signs observation sub score

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Obseve the service provider while attending a pregnant woman.At least two observations have to be conducted.If a facility has more than one service provider,observation should be made to different providers.If there is only one provider then all observations should be done for that health service provider.Do not interrupt unless the patient is severely ill or if the practice of the service provider will put the client in danger.If a patient is severely ill then the supervisor should assist in giving treatment while doing mentorship to the available clinicians and other health service providers.Did the health service provider ask/check for the following danger symptoms and signs?

subSections.title: E.4 Preventive Services at ANC

inputRows.label: Did the health service provider ask if the client had any symptoms(fever or any other sysmptom) for malaria?
If the mother reported the symptoms of malaria ,was this patient tested for malaria?
If test results were positive,was the patient escorted to OPD for treatment?
Did the provider counsel the patient about malaria prevention?
Was the patient provided with LLIN?<em>(Choose NA if this is not client's first visit)
Was iron and folic acid supplements given to the pregnant woman?

subSections.instruction: Observe 2 clients who have attended ANC while receiving service from the health service provider.Note if the provider does the following . Did the health service provider ask/check for the following?

subSections.title: E.5 Diagnosis and Treatment

inputRows.label: Does the provider order an mRDT ?(N/A if no fever

If Yes, does the provider perform the correct follow up actions based on mRDT result.

If positive, treats with ant-malaria
If yes, does the provider advice and prescribe  Cotrimoxazole 960 mg tabs for CPT daily?
Provide enough ferrous sulphate /folic acid /FEFOL to last until the next visit?
Explain the side effects of taking ferrous sulphate?
Administer (or prescribe)Mebendazole 500mg/Albendazole 400 mg by DOT once by chewing after 1st trimester ?(N/A if 1st trimester or already had dose)

subSections.instruction: Instructions:Observe the service provider while attending a pregnant woman.At least two observations have to be conducted.If a facility has more than one service provider, observations should be made to different providers.If there is only one provider then all observations should be done for that health service provider.Do not interrupt unless the patient is severely ill or if the practise of the service provider will put the client in danger.If the patient is severely ill then the supervisor should assist in giving treatment while doing mentorship to the available clinicians and other health service providers.If there is no cient during facility visit, simulation should be done

subSections.title: E.6 Other Laboratory Tests
subSections.instruction: Instructions:Observe the service provider while attending a pregnant woman.At least two observations have to be conducted.If a facility has more than one service providers,observations should be made to different providers.If there is only one provider then all observations should be done for that health service provider.Do not interrupt unless the patient is severely ill or if the practise of the service provider will put the client in danger.If a patient is severely ill then the supervisor should assist in giving treatment while doing mentorship to the available clinicians and other health service providers.Did the health service provider request or check the patient's records for the following tests?

subSections.title: E.7 Treatment Services at ANC

inputRows.label: Was the patient in first trimester of pregnancy?
Did the provider ensure that the patient adhere to treatment?
If yes was this patient treated using tablets Quinine ?
Was Quinine tablets prescribed in correct dose for the weight of the patient?
Was Quinine tablets prescribed in correct regimen and duration?
Was clindamycin prescribed to be taken along with Quinine tablets?
Was clindamycin prescribed in correct dose for the weight of the patient?
Was clindamycin prescribed in correct regimen?
If Quinine was not available or there was uncertainity of adherence
Was the patient treated using Artesunate + Amodiaquine (AS+ AQ)
Was the AS+AQ prescribed in correct dose for the weight of the patient?
Was the AS+AQ prescribed in correct regimen?
If the patient was in 2nd or 3rd trimester of pregnancy
Was the patient treated using AS + AQ or Artemeter + Lumefantrine (ALu)?
Was the AS+AQ or ALu prescribed in correct dosage for the weight of the patient?
Was the AS+AQ or ALu prescribed in correct regimen?
Uncomplicated Malaria Treat observation sub score

subSections.instruction:
Use this section if the patient was diagnosed to have uncomplicated malaria

Instruction:If the ANC client had symptoms/signs of malaria,was tested and was treated,use the following section to assess the treatment provided.Supervisor to follow the patient to the treatment point i.e ANC or OPD .If there is no client during facility visit or client not diagnosed to have uncomplicated malaria, simulation should be done.

subSections.title: E.8 Severe Malaria Treatment Services at ANC

inputRows.label: Was injection Artesunate prescribed for this patient?
Was Artesunate prescribed in correct dose for the patient's weight?
Was Artesunate prescribed in correct regimen?
Was the patient admitted or referred?
Severe Malaria Treatment observation sub score

subSections.instruction:
Use this section if the patient was diagnosed to have complicated malaria

Observe 2 clients who have attended ANC while receiving service from the health service provider. If there is no client during facility visit or client not diagnosed to have severe malaria, simulation should be done.

subSections.title: E.9 Counselling and Communication

inputRows.label: Sets date for the next visit with the client and encourages her to return to the next scheduled visit
Informs the woman that she can come anytime if she has any of the danger symptoms and signs or any concerns
Legibly records all required information on ANC,TT Cards,Register and other registers. (mark partial if information recorded in some tools leaving others not recorded)
Ask the woman to repeat back the most important points of the counseling
Ask about,and responds to,any question that the woman asked
Counselling and Communication observation sub score

subSections.instruction:
Instructions:Observe the service provider while attending a pregnant woman.At least two observations have to be conducted.If a facility has more than one service provider,observations should be made to different providers.If there is only one provider then all observations should be done for that health service provider.Do not interrupt unless the patient is severely ill or if the practice of the service provider will put the client in danger.If a patient is severely ill then the supervisor should assist in giving treatment while doing mentorship to the available clinicians and other health service providers.

If there is no client during facility visit,, simulation should be done.

inputRows.label: Section E: ANC Competence in managing pregnant women Score

sections.title: Section F: Health Education at ANC

inputRows.label: Did the health workers conduct any malaria education session to clients to day in the past three months?
If Yes, which topic was presented or discussed?
Environmental management for source reduction of vector density e.g drainage of breeding sites
Importance of blood screening through mRDT/Microscopy before treatment
Prompt treatment of children with fever-taking antimalaria medicine the same or next day of fever onset
Supportive treatment ;such as fever management and uptake of adequate fluids & food

sections.instruction: Instructions:Ask if there is continuous maternal health education at the ANC encouraging the use of all interventions and services

sections.title: Section G.ANC Exit Interviews

inputRows.label: Were you able to get a client for interview?
Was the length of time taken to wait in order to be seen by the health care provider reasonable?
Did the health care provider listen to you when you were explaining your problem or child's problem?
Did the health care provider ask /tell what is wrong with you or your child?
Were you given enough privacy when treated or advised?(The door was closed no other clients inside,not exposed during procedure etc)
Were you confident with the health care provider who was treating/advising you or your child?(probe)
Did the health care provider involve you in decision about the treatment?
Did the health care provider give you the instructions on how to use the medicines in a way that you could understand?
Does the health facility environment meet your expectation of cleanliness?
Were you educated about malaria prevention and control?
Do you think you can recommend the service you received from this HFs to your family and other people?

sections.instruction: Instructions:Conduct exit interview to two clients who have just received services at ANC before they leave a facility to assess client satisfication
